Description: An informative video carefully going through the definition of angles, the different kinds, and how to measure them.
A nice video that uses alternative exterior, alternate interior, corresponding angles, and corresponding interior angles, to prove that a pair of lines are parallel.
A video by Khan Academy going over indirect measurement.  Start at 6:20 if you want to skip the example scale diagram problem.
This video shows you just one of the many examples a triangle may be congruent, via the AAS rule.
A video showing how to solve for the remaining angle/bases of an isosceles triangle, as well as solving the same problem using an equilateral triangle.

In this fun talk, see some real-world applications of kites! Saul Griffith shows an invention his company has been working on: giant kite turbines that create surprising amounts of clean, renewable energy.

Description: This is a Khan Academy video describing the Angle Bisector Theorem and its proof.

Resource Name: The Fractals at the Heart of African Designs (16:55)
Description: This video addresses the origins of fractals and their accidental applications in primitive cultures.

Video title: The Fractals at the Heart of African Designs

Description: This video talks about where reflective and rotational symmetry occurs in the world in art and architecture, and addresses new ways to look at objects and evaluate their symmetry. Start at 6:00 to skip less relevant background information.
This interactive may seem a bit boring, but it shows you what vertical angles are and, more importantly, how moving the rays around affect the size of the angle itself.

Resource Name: Introduction to Inductive and Deductive Reasoning
Description: A very helpful interactive that teaches you the concepts of conjectures, inductive and deductive reasoning, and more.

This interactive generates questions about transversals of two parallel lines. It helps in identifying the size of angles and the relationship between them. Click "New Angles" to generate a new question after checking your work.

Resource Name: Angle Sum Theorem for a Triangle
Description: A simple interactive that allows you to play with a triangle and see how the angles change when you move on of the vertices.
This interactive allows you to explore the different kinds of triangle, all their side and angle combinations, and how they can be scaled to form similar triangles.
This link contains a short quiz about ratios.
This website gives some practice dilation problems. (If you get the question right, the website will tell you.)
This interactive allows you to explore the Pythagorean Theorem and visualize the side lengths and their squares and how they fit together.
This is an interactive website that allows you to make tangent lines.
This is an interactive quiz about major and minor arcs. It also includes an explanation beforehand.
This is an interactive quiz about chords in circles. It also includes an explanation beforehand.

Resource Name: Inscribed Angle of a Circle and its Intercepted Arc
Description: This is an interactive quiz about inscribed angles in circles. It also includes an explanation beforehand along with an interactive demo.

This interactive allows you to set a perimeter and see how many different areas correspond to it. As you increase the perimeter, you can see shapes with very different areas. Why can shapes with so many different areas all have the same perimeter?
In this interactive you can see how changing the size of a circle affects its radius and cirumference.
In this interactive you can see how changing the size of a circle affects its area.
This website shows five polyhedrons and their planar nets.

This exciting interactive allows you to view different cross sections of many different figures on the coordinate plane. You can view different cross sections based off of selected positions on the x-, y-, and z-axes.
This interactive allows you to see how you can use both the x- and y-coordinates and a distance and angle to translate objects. You can explore different angles, distances, amounts, and shapes!
This fun interactive allows you to create any polygon you want on the coordinate plane and then rotate, reflect, and translate it any number of units in any direction!
